chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin M. Kuhl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--no operation of a motor vehicle without valid DL and agent approval 

--no possession or consumption of any controlled substances without a valid prescription

--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores-

--not engage in any acts or threats of violence

--absolute sobriety

--submit to UA's at the discretion of the DOC

--undergo any assessment, treatment, or therapies as directed by DOC

 --If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

ARRESTING AGENCY: Lake Mills PD
--AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per agent

records.addlTxt: The Court has already exercised its discretion on this matter and no valid reason is presented to reconsider. pc: all
From defendant requesting reinstatement of Huber privileges.
Approved for limited Huber for CSW purposed ONLY - Judge Wambach
Petition for reinstatement reviewed and denied - Judge Wambach
from Defendant requesting huber privileges be reinstated
Counsel's request is denied as was Mr. Kuhl's
from Attorney Klein requesting huber privileges be reinstated for the defendant
Jefferson County DNA Proof of Submission

Cases 15CF160 and 15CF385 called together at 3:51pm [mo]
Defendant Justin M. Kuhl in court with Attorney Jessica A Klein.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

As to Case 15CF385:
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Count #1 of Case 15CF385 and Count #1 of 15CF160:
The Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Kuhl on Probation for a term of 3 years, with conditons:

--As to Case 15CF385: To serve  6 months   in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence FORTHWITH
--Days credit for time already served: 1 day 
--As to Case 15CF385: To pay the minimum fine plus costs
--As to Case 15CF160: to pay statutory costs

The Court adopts the conditions of probation as outlined in the CCS.
[which are: 
--absolute sobriety
--no operation of a motor vehicle without valid DL and agent approval 
--no possession or consumption of any controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--submit to UA's at the discretion of the DOC
--not engage in any acts or threats of violence
--undergo any assessment, treatment, or therapies as directed by DOC
--AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per agent ]

The Court orders, as to Case 15CF385 only: 
--Revocation of drivers license for 33 months
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 33 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed

The Court does not order a victim impact panel 
recess: 4:14pm
Sentencing hearing on May 24, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

recess: 3:53pm--reconvene:4:12pm

As to case 15CF160 only:
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1 of Case 15CF160; factual basis stipulated;the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses Count #2 of Case 15CF160

Cases 15CF160 and 15CF385 called together at 10:55am [mo]
Defendant Justin M. Kuhl in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.   DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Klein requests a Waiver of Preliminary Hearing occur in case 15CF385

As to Case 15CF385:
Mr. Kuhl waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
recess: 11:05am

NEXT:  As to Case 15CF385: (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/2/16 at 10:00am    (2) Status Conference on 4/18/16 at 3:00pm
            As to Case 15CF160: (1) FSSC on 4/18/16 at 3:00pm (2)Jury Trial on 4/21/16 at 8:30am (JA please send Scheduling Order w/NOHs)

Case called at 10:01am [mo]
Defendant, Justin Kuhl does NOT appear in court. 
Attorney Jessica A Klein in court.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews the Court Record.
Atty. Klein indicates that she has mis-informed Mr. Kuhl that todays hearing was a Pretrial conference and that he did not need to attend. 
Atty. Klein gives case synopsis; indicates that a global resolution with case 15CF385 is possible.

With no objection from ADA Shock, the Court adjourns this case to 2/2/16 at 10:30am
recess: 10:07am

NEXT: Status Conference on 2/2/16 at 10:30am

Case called at 9:10am [mo]
Defendant Justin M. Kuhl in court with Attorney Jessica Klein.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Klein indicates that she had previously submitted a waiver of preliminary hearing form.

Mr.Kuhl waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered on all counts

The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Kuhl. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.
recess: 9:20am

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on  10/21/15 at 9:20am  (2) Status Conference on 12/8/15 at 10:00am

Case called at 8:32am [mo]
Defendant Justin M. Kuhl does NOT appear in court.
Attorney Jessica Klein appears in court.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance.

The Court reviews the Court Record, including a letter submitted by Atty. Klein requesting an adjournment due to Mr. Kuhl's current medical condition
--ADA Shock reviews the letter and does not object to the request
--The Court grants the request for adjournment and directs the Clerk to re-schedule the hearing.

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.

recess: 8:37am

NEXT: Waiver of Prelim/Arraignment on 10/5/2015 at 9:00am
Courts response to the request to adjourn
Court orders preliminary waiver and arraignment be scheduled cc: all

Case called at 3:04 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for adjourned initial appearance)
Defendant Justin M. Kuhl in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews that Mr. Kuhl appeared previously & requested counsel so matter was adjourned to today's date/time
Mr. Kuhl informs the Court that he has contacted SPD, but have not yet heard back from them regarding eligibility. Still need appointment to fill out paperwork.
Court continues bond as previously set with added condition that Mr. Kuhl contact the SPD every day until determination is made
Recess: 3:08 pm 

NEXT:  Reschedule Adjourned Initial Appearance 8/4/15 at 2:00 pm - Send notices

Case called at 2:38 pm [Clerk SH]
[Court Reporter: Lisa Zinda]
Defendant Justin M. Kuhl in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; DOB & address confirmed accurate; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Court finds probable cause within the complaint to support Counts #1 & #2

Court requires a $2000 signature bond, with conditions:
-No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid DL 
-Booking at JCSD 

Court reviews conflict review worksheet; finds no conflict & endorses  worksheet
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Mr. Kuhl informs the Court that he would like counsel in this matter
Recess: 2:48 pm
